{{< entity_summary >}}
The Government of Canada spent an estimated **\$6.6M in 2021-2022** on contracts with POINT HOPE MARITIME.

Across 8 contracts active since the start of the 2017-2018 fiscal year, 5 have at least one amendment (62%). Of contracts with amendments, the average increase in dollar value was 31% and the average number of amendments was 1.6. Cumulatively these amendments represent an increase of \$4.7M over the original contract values.

The average contract duration was 0.53 years, and the average contract value (not including contracts under \$10k) was \$2.3M. The longest contract was 2.55 years. The largest contract by value (including amendments) was \$12.7M.

{{< /entity_summary >}}
